Umm, Claw, maybe it isn't right to ask this here, but maybe you could keep this OP updated while Fengist is on \*Insert time\* hiatus?

I have just completed the Elcano Challenge for Eeloo [here](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/127073-the-elcano-chronicles/).

Any feedback or comments would be appreciated.

Details: Stock, 1.0.5, wheel-driven RTG powered rover using a skycrane to drop from orbit.

Mods: Engineer ('cause who doesn't), Mechjeb, Hyperedit (for testing, since I build my missions backwards).

I'm going to take a break from Elcano's for a bit to have a go at the Jool 5 challenge. Wish me luck!

Hello everyone, long-time lurker and new forum member here. Always thought that this challenge was an interesting one, though unfortunately didn't have much of an excuse to perform it. However, in my career mode I have recently landed a hulking 26kg rover to trek around Duna. It landed roughly near the equator in the canyon and I figured that I'd drive over to my first interplanetary probe, landed on the equator about 1/3 around the planet. So, for the hell of it, I'm seeing if I can do this challenge "while I'm at it".

![2015-12-18_00001_zpsqtxzxgro.jpg](http://i1183.photobucket.com/albums/x478/bleedswhenshot/2015-12-18_00001_zpsqtxzxgro.jpg)

![2015-12-18_00003_zpszf0ulicl.jpg](http://i1183.photobucket.com/albums/x478/bleedswhenshot/2015-12-18_00003_zpszf0ulicl.jpg)

![2015-12-18_00008_zpsg5wbx5nx.jpg](http://i1183.photobucket.com/albums/x478/bleedswhenshot/2015-12-18_00008_zpsg5wbx5nx.jpg)

(I have five crew on here, including an engineer, so the wheel is fine ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif ":P"))

Driving's probably the hardest (and most challenging, imo) thing to do in KSP. I can really only drive this thing safely at 20-25m/s in case I accidentally ramp the truck. Going to limit myself to maybe an hour or two of driving per day.

I would like to record my journey, though the Mission Reports link in OP seems to be broken.

I've started a journey log here ([http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/128240-big-rig-elcano/#comment-2329762](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/128240-big-rig-elcano/#comment-2329762)). Since I started at around 5 degrees north of the equator, do I need to make up for it by driving to the first flag I plant on the equator and then making my way back to the original flag?

Hey guys. I'm doing a Kerbin water circumnavigation. Mission report here [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/128315-kerbin-water-elcano-challenge/#comment-2330841](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/128315-kerbin-water-elcano-challenge/#comment-2330841)

![WpR7Mr3.png](http://i.imgur.com/WpR7Mr3.png)

I have just completed the Elcano Challenge for Gilly [here](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/127073-the-elcano-chronicles/).

Any feedback or comments would be appreciated.

Details: Stock, 1.0.5, ion-driven fuel-cell powered rover dropping from orbit under it's own power.

Mods: Engineer ('cause who doesn't), Mechjeb, Hyperedit (for testing, since I build my missions backwards).

Back to my Jool-5 attempt now! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

Question for those taking the Elcano challenge: I'm driving a mere 100km on Duna right now to move my base. My "Catepillar" craft keeps smacking into invisible boulders or potholes or something, because I can be driving along smoothly, and then WHAM! It's as if I slammed into something head on. I was wondering if others are experiencing that during their challenge.

> 

I haven't experienced any of that since I've started my Duna journey. I'll post if I do, however.
Like half the reports go to your OP

I drove around Duna near the start of 2015.  Here's the album documenting the trip.

<iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="//imgur.com/a/pNfX9/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>

We all spend so much time in KSP in big rockets, trying to go to other planets, and we are sad when they drop down to Kerbin and explode. It's like we spend all our time in the game trying to *leave* Kerbin, and it's beauty never gets appreciated as much as it should. That's why I'd like to try this challenge, to explore all the way around the planet. I will probably have a vehicle ready for the trek in a few days. Here's the first design, which worked pretty well:

<iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="//imgur.com/a/4qUsa/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>

I drove it on the runway and on the flat land by KSC, testing timewarp (which broke the drills) and solar panels, and turning. It's quite stable on land at less than 2-3x timewarp. Then I drove it off the coast into Booster Bay (that's what it's called right?). The jets give out every couple of seconds, keeping the velocity at a relatively constant 8 m/s. I was able to get about halfway to the abandoned airstrip before the game crashed. Promising design overall, and I've made a second design already. I'll have to post a mission report on it once I get more screenshots of testing.

Edit: Here's the in-progress report: [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/128682-the-kerbin-appreciation-project/](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/128682-the-kerbin-appreciation-project/)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-12-26T21:16:21Z" title="12/26/2015 09:16  PM" data-short="8 yr">December 26, 2015</time> by cubinator**

I've exchanged PMs with Fengist, and it seems he won't be returning for a long while.

I've [reposted the Elcano Challenge here for continuation](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/128687-the-elcano-challenge-continued/). Over the next few days, I will be updating the new thread with completions posted since Fengist's last update. Should Fengist return, the two threads will be merged and Elcano will continue as before.

Cheers,  

~Claw
